definition: harakiri (formal Japanese: seppuku), a samurai's suicide by disemboweling
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: Samurai women could only commit the act with permission.
sentences.chinese: 而女性武士只有得到许可后才能切腹自杀。

sentences.english: Jiangchuan for the failure of shame, she is going to cut abdomen to the emperor to malaysians.
sentences.chinese: 江川为这次的失败羞愧难当，她准备切腹向天皇谢罪。

sentences.english: Defeated warriors (samurai) often resorted to hara-kiri.
sentences.chinese: 落败的武士总是采用切腹的死法。

definition: bushidō or way of the warrior, samurai code of chivalry
to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault
to be buried alive as sacrifice (together with husband or superior)
to cut open the abdomen/to disembowel/to speak from the heart
to commit suicide by cutting one's own throat
to slit one's own throat/to commit suicide
the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)
